titleStmt.title: Tvvo letters: One written by a Protestant to his brother being a Papist, to withdraw him foorth of the countrie of the Papists, who was partly by him perswaded, but that his wealth made him peremptorie, wherupon he tooke occasion to vvrite this letter, to moue him rather to make choice of the kingdome of God, then the riches of the vvorld. The other written by Master Ramon, a minister of the word of God, being prisoner in the citie of Valencia, to his wife being in London, to comfort her; who after suffered for the gospell. Translated out of French
